about_the_game:
Fusionist is a turn-based strategy game that offers depth and tactical gameplay. Players assemble a team of five mechs, each with unique skills and roles. By choosing different "Cores" and mech abilities, players can create their own unique "builds" to suit their playstyle, play in-game missions, or compete in intense PvP battles against other players.

Key Features:

 

Mech Builds and Skill Combinations:

One of the core gameplay features is mech building. Players can select different "Cores" and mech skills to design their ideal team. The game features three elemental types: Frozen, Burn, and Electric. By strategically combining these skills, players can trigger "chemical reactions," such as Frozen's crowd control effects, Burn's damage over time, or Electric's high chain-attack damage.

 

Diverse Class Roles:

   There are five distinct classes in the game, each with unique abilities and tactical roles:

   - Striker: Excels in close combat, quickly closing the gap with enemies and disrupting their formations.

   - Keystone: Specializes in defense, using shield-based weapons to block incoming attacks and create space for teammates to deal damage.

   - Buster: Specializes in long-range bombardment, using heavy weaponry to anchor the team’s firepower.

   - Bullseye: A sniper class that excels at long-range attacks and can eliminate enemies from a distance.

   - Apostle: Provides backline support, specializes in control-type weapons, and acts as the team's tactical core.

 

Mech Forging and Upgrades:

The game features a gacha-like mech forging system where players collect blueprints and materials to craft new mechs. Each mech can be leveled up and enhanced with additional skills, allowing for further customization and improvement of their combat abilities.

 

Turn-Based Combat and Strategic Positioning:

The combat system is turn-based, requiring players to make tactical decisions based on the enemy's lineup and the flow of battle. The order of actions, skill choices, and positioning of mechs all influence the outcome of the battle, making strategic placement and real-time adjustments crucial.

 

PvP Battles:

A key aspect of the game is PvP combat. Players can challenge others from around the world in intense battles, testing the strength and synergy of their mechs. As players progress, they unlock higher-level features and rewards to enhance their gameplay experience.

 

Elemental Reactions and Tactical Depth:

The elemental system adds an extra layer of strategy to combat. Combining Frozen, Burn, and Electric skills can trigger powerful "chemical reactions" that change the course of the battle. For example, Burn and Electric combinations can cause widespread damage, while Frozen and Electric interactions can freeze enemies in place. This system ensures that every battle is full of potential strategies.

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10
  • Processor: INTEL CORE I5-8400 or AMD RYZEN 3 3300X
  • Memory: 12 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GEFORCE GTX 1060 3 GB or AMD RADEON RX 580 4 GB
  • DirectX: Version 11
  • Storage: 6 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Windows Compatible Audio Device
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: Windows 10/11
  • Processor: INTEL CORE I7-8700K or AMD RYZEN 5 3600X
  • Memory: 16 GB RAM
  • Graphics: NVIDIA GEFORCE GTX 1070 8 GB or AMD RADEON RX VEGA 56 8 GB
  • DirectX: Version 12
  • Storage: 6 GB available space
  • Sound Card: Windows Compatible Audio Device
